channel.title: history on Nailing Jelly
channel.description: Recent content in history on Nailing Jelly

item.title: Bletchley Park
item.description: There has been a lot of activity on Twitter this morning regarding Bletchley Park - the home of the wartime British decryption effort, and effectively the birthplace of modern computing. Have a look at http://savingbletchleypark.org/ for information. Bletchley Park is decaying, and in danger of becoming unsustainable - meaning a good chunk of modern computing history will be lost to the world. The normal funding mechanisms (National Lottery etc) have declined to support Bletchley Park.

item.title: Handling Mail
item.description: I pretty much live by email. I’ve been using it for around 25 years now, and have had good access to internet email for close on 20 years. I’ve been on open development mailing lists for all of that time, and have at times been receiving many hundreds (if not thousands) of messages a day. I obviously don’t read all those messages - not in detail - and since I maintain a bunch of machines that send all sorts of general notification mail, much of it is glanced at (ie just look at sender and subject) and either ignored or deleted.
